d5eK2YoGLd5zU0tqhYw_Hg.text: I like this place better than Uncle Sam's (heresy).  The biggest complaint here on Yelp is that it is a bit pricey, and it is compared to (say) Charlie's.  But the quality of the meat is very good.  Thin sliced rib eye, no gristle or fat, tasty.  And Uncle Sam's is about a buck and a half more expensive.  That evens out if you order mushrooms, which Sam's includes but for which Corleone's charges extra.  And I like the condiment bar.  A little garlic powder, some banana peppers, perhaps some oregano and/or parmason cheese.  Season to suit.  The price gets helped out with specials and coupons.  Your cash register receipt is usually good for $2 off your next visit.  They have specials for a six inch sandwich, fries and a drink for $5 (would be closer to $10 without the special). {Edit: that might no longer be True.]  I've not tried the pizza.  I'm not a big fan of NY style pizza, even though I lived in Manhattan.  Other's have given it thumbs up, though.

0Nz1U4XqLJgvEFiEKsP2Ww.text: I have been going to Corleone's for a few months now because I wanted to try several things on the menu before I judge the place. Being a fan of Philly Steaks I thought this place would be good by the classic look of the place.   I got the tuesday night special where if you get 1 large sub for 10 bucks (without a drink of fries) you get a small one for free. It was interesting because I saw a lot of people order a large sub, and they weren't notified of the daily special. So I ordered the regular philly steak with a small hoagie.  He asked me if I wanted mushrooms or peppers on my philly steak, and i said yes, and I didint know that was an extra charge.   The Philly Steak was mediocre at best. They use low quality meat, and overcook it. The bread could be a lot better.  The guy suggested I put oil and vinger on the small hoagie I got, and I know why because it sucked! Covering it with tons of oil and vinegar is not gonna do the job if it's bad to begin with.  The only thing good here is the pizza and the fries. Stay away from everything else as it's also overpriced! $13 bucks for a philly steak combo? are you kidding me? Tell people about your specials, and stop penny pinching people for extra money. Tell me if peppers and mushrooms will be an extra charge.   In my opinion if you are gonna eat this bad for this price it might as well be good!

tJXcuZRZJcjfua03Yd6hzw.text: I was craving a Philly Cheese Steak today and so after considering the reviews of a number of restaurants offering them. I decided that Corleone's was the best bet for a real Philadelphia style cheese steak near my zip code.   Because it is a chain, I arrived slightly skeptical, and ready to have a less than wonderful experience, in spite of the positive ratings. Thank goodness the positive reviews were accurate!  I arrived barely ahead of the lunch crowd. At least 15 people crowded in right behind me, which I took for a good sign. I ordered the small rib eye steak sandwich "wit" (with) grilled onions, grilled peppers & mushrooms, and mozzarella cheese. I skipped the cheese wiz because my memory of Philly cheese steaks in Philly and NY as I was growing up had NO association what-so-ever with cheese wiz. The young man who took my order was very helpful with my order, and my eventual cheese choice of mozzarella over provolone.  (Mozzarella melts better he said, and he was right!)  My sandwich was completely cooked to order. There was no partially cooked steak sitting to the side of a grill waiting to be warmed and served - this was cooked fresh! The onions, mushrooms and green peppers were also perfectly grilled, and combined with the meat and mozzarella cheese were perfect! The bun initially had a bit of crunch, so I think that the inside was grilled or toasted.  All in all, it was a delicious sandwich. The meat was nicely cooked and the sandwich was nice and juicy and perfectly seasoned. I added a combination of the hot cherry peppers and a few sweet cherry peppers from the condiment bar to my sandwich to make each bite just right. The cheese was perfectly hot and melted, creating delicious strands of cheese from the sandwich to my mouth. Once I started eating, I could not put the sandwich down. It was REALLY good. FAR better than I would have expected from a Philly Cheese Steak in Arizona...  I didn't try any of the sides, but the pizza did look really good. I think it will be a while however, before I have anything but the cheese steak - just like I had it today!  For a small cheese steak and a small drink, my tab was nine dollars and change, but it was worth every penny!

PONmIgLxm4G3fgjUg5nHvA.text: Previously ordered from here and was always pleased . Today my order was 20 mins late. My husband had to go out looking for the driver. Then I get the driver was smug about not bro g compensated for his tardiness ... hopefully this is just a fluke

8M1j-Wnkc3XqIO9M77KcXQ.text: Ok so for all those that have never had a real Philly Cheesesteak, understand your negative reviews do not equal to those that have grown up in Philly. FXpdeZQBFNRl_AxpedcmkQ.text: ** Insert cliche' Godfather phrase here **  Ok... now that that's out of the way, I have to say that after two visits here to Corleone's, I'm surprisingly a fan.   Why surprisingly? Mostly because it's a chain and I'm generally opposed to such establishments. However, there's just something I like about this place. The decor and vibe even feels like you're in a little, slightly shady sandwich shop in Philly. Not that I've ever been to Philly, but it's stereotypical of what I would expect it to be like.   I think one of the Rocky movies has been playing on the one tv each time I've been here. There's a pyramid of Cheez Whiz cans. Philadelphia Eagles stuff, and of course a picture of the namesake Don Corleone (Marlon Brando) on the wall.   Do they make the best Philly cheesesteak I've had? No. But it is pretty good. The last time I was here I tried a slice of their pizza because it looked fantastic... Lo and Behold it was really good, thin crust deliciousness. One of the better pizza slices I've had in Phoenix, believe it or not.   To top everything off, the guys that work here have been friendly on both visits.. not bubbly friendly, but cool guy friendly. They welcome you, say goodbye and thank you for coming... but they do it cool... You know what I mean. I think that goes with the Philly atmosphere too.  Overall, if you're in the area and looking for a decent bite to eat, this is a good choice.   **Insert cliche' Godfather phrase closing statement here**

tIgY3f2BGXIAnVEFas_yiw.text: No it's NOT Pat's King of Steaks                                                             or                                                       Geno's                                                             or                                                     PUDGE'S                                                                      but it more like someone else in town.   Coreone's is a Genuine Taste of Philly as they make their Rib Eye Steak Sandwiches on Philly's Amoroso's Rolls. I didn't try the soft pretzels but I can tell you they sure LOOK like real Philly Pretzels you'd but off street corners. If your in the mood for dessert they also sell Philly's Famous TastyKakes that everyone knows. The casual place sure makes anyone from Philadelphia fell at home with that old Philadelphia look and all the really interesting iconic Philadelphia Memorabilia all around with a "Rocky Movie" playing on one of the TV's.   I tried a small steak combo. The small is plenty big and at least half the people out there only need a small. The ingredients are right so it passes as a Philly Steak Sandwich. Technically I'd like the sandwich tweaked a little different and the meat and onions less chopped up but it was still a good sandwich. I helped myself to the condiment bar and added HOT CHERRY PEPPERS and a few sweet cherry peppers and they were really good. For me it isn't a Philly Steak unless you have those delicious Cherry Peppers on it.    I wasn't a big fan of the onion rings but the fries were good.  My husband had the regular size combo. He ate many more cheese steaks in Philly than I did. He thought it was the best Cheese Steak he had in Arizona so far. I thought the regular size one was enormous and can feed two people. I asked my husband if he would get a small size next time and he said NO WAY.   They offer other menu items like Philly Style Pizza (I might try next time and tell you if it is)  Chicken Steaks and Hoagies.  For me this really was a  fun "TASTE of Philadelphia" and I didn't have to drive down the Schuylkill to get there.

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Regular Size Combo
Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HOT CHERRY PEPPERS
Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet Cherry Peppers

USLlzLAENqUi-XPwU4edOg.text: That was the best Philly Cheese Steak I've ever had! The Steak was perfect, juicy, but not greasy. But mix that with Kraft Cheez Whiz, grilled onions on a toasted hoagie roll... I dont know how it could have been any better.   Oh wait, it was, the fries made it the perfect American lunch. They were amazing with the Cheese Steak. Golden, crispy and delicious!   I am so full though, couldn't even finish the fries, I would definitely get a small if it is your first time, you won't be disappointed!   All of that wrapped up in a fun old time feel, with tall booths, wood tables and Philly memorabilia that made me miss the East coast all over again. They had Sports on a couple TVs and the movie Rocky playing on another. The music was a nice background, and not too loud, so you could hold a conversation.   The staff were really nice, but the service was really quick for being so busy. It makes me want to come back over and over again!   Found a new favorite!

ucFcec-iobkhsPNaY-pO6Q.text: I find it hard to go anywhere else but here for Philly Cheesesteaks!  You guys rock!!!

VsF-1i3LhRnQeKJZwpKYTg.text: Amazing every time I come here! My sandwich and fries are always hot and the employees always have a smile on their face! Thank you for continuously making great food!

EiXgqaIxPyfyKji8aYxAGA.text: Ordered "the original" w/jalapenos - $10! Not even a combo. Only ate half. It was filling - but is the taste/quality worth the money? Nope. I'm assuming it has to do with location. The look of the pizza was not appetizing. The cheese looked dry which is one of the reasons I didn't order it. The inside was clean & organized so I appreciated that!

1ETI4pnwoZESRggfCaCM7w.text: It's extremely difficult to find an edible cheese steak sandwich in Phoenix,  but I discovered a shop that does it right! Tucked into a shopping center on the north-east corner of 16th St. and Camelback is a place that has the best cheese steaks in Phoenix.  They also offer pizza, pretzels and wings. They have a condiment bar with sweet pickled peppers that are a great accompaniment to the sandwiches.  We always order too much food because everything we've tried on the menu is a little taste of Philly. Oh well,  it re-heats nicely.

NeVh0z54EBGvV0HUEdwHaA.text: Midweek...don't wanna cook...don't wanna drive...who delivers?? CORLEONE'S!! The delivery person was a sweetheart which is the equivalent of having a pleasant waiter/waitress to start your meal experience. It sets the mood and expectations and well...it was yummy!   If you order the cheese fries, make sure you eat those first since cheez wiz has a limited time frame for being fresh and hot. Once it chills, you end up with...well...goop. I love their cheesesteak sandwiches, this time the fries were a little overdone but still not too bad.   For a $20 we ordered a couple of cheesesteak sandwiches and split a cheese fry, just enough food and it doesn't break the bank. Not bad for delivery!

KY0VDqF-uUGtjbV1MoaKCA.text: love that the offer delivery! the cheese steaks are always amazing & staff is friendly. The delivery service is just as good as going inside!

8P6Z55R3VycJQ1MCgriGeA.text: For a chicken cheese steak, a cold italian sub (hoagie), or a slice of great thin-crust pizza, this is my destination.   They also usually have Tastykakes...from Philly....but don't tell, or they might run out!

K9IBgLD3vMqA7vT17YdN9w.text: Grade A cheese steaks at a reasonable price. Probably one of the best places to grab a philly in the PHX area. I'm so glad this place uses cheese whiz!!!

AdR3GoxHcbFttpNsIz3d2w.text: Okay so I've been coming here for a year now and I  usually get the to slice to go with the pretzel because I love Philadelphia pretzels and for the last year I've been allowed to use my $2 discount it comes on every receipt until today when apparently some new girl explains for some reason or another I'm not allowed to use this coupon well that's okay because I can live without the Philadelphia Pretzel and get pizza someplace else goodbye Colon it was nice coming here for a year but apparently it is time to move on.

HXScwpGQ8mjvZdECmiiM5g.text: I'm a fan of Corleone's. First of all, the name is awesome. The food is good but not great. The thing that makes it 4 stars, in my opinion, is their pricing. I recently ordered a huge pizza and a side of mozzarella sticks for delivery on a Friday night. The total price for my order (including tip) was $15. Full disclosure, I had a $5 off coupon from a previous order but that isn't the point.   Cheap & good food. Can't beat it.

8FjcESf5khMmYRO8HnKLgg.text: good Philly, nice thin pizza w/oregano ... place is kinda dirty, tables were not bussed, but food's good, I'll go back

R6Km8qpcQCJK-mreb10xMw.text: Not enough flavor to overcome the immediate guilt upon eating one of those sandwiches.  If I'm going to eat something that is going to shave a few months off my life expectancy I want the experience to be memorable.  And it was salty....like "Dead Sea" salty.  Maybe it's because I'm such a Dallas Cowboys fan, but I find the cheesesteak to be among the most overrated of the street foods.

VeHRxtjWcH8AXmFxHYpEBA.text: YES.    This is exactly what I was hoping for.  Just cheesy enough, just beefy enough, just greasy enough, just awesome enough.  (got the cheesesteak if it wasn't obvious)  Not mind-blowing, but that's kind of the goal, right?  Bread, wiz, steak and onions.  Exactly what the doctor ordered.    Would definitely eat here again.

djcSC71Sdez-erno95EhqQ.text: Service was awful. The food was ok.  I ordered their Italian hoagie which was probably my first mistake because they are known for their cheesesteak.   I noticed I had been waiting for 15 minutes so I started looking to see where they were with my order. My sandwich was sitting in the back while some employee wandered around that was supposed to be making it talking about hitting on some girl and getting her name wrong.   10 more minutes went by so I asked where my sandwich was at the counter and it had been ready to go but left it sitting back there.   The guy who made it asked me if I wanted anything extra in apology but I just said no thanks and left.   The sandwich kind of sucked. It was average at best and absolutely not worth the 30min wait

-iZ0tqlXVm2Oda8qwf9ikw.text: Ordered the small cheese steak with grilled onions. Excellent bread and tasty made to order. I like the doll pickle jar by the sodas. Definitely on my stopping list on camelback.

eLOrV6n3SpYU7W07ToA2AA.text: This is the best buffalo chicken sandwich that I've ever had.  The fries are remarkable.  This was my favorite place to eat while I lived in Phoenix, by far, and what I miss most about the whole state.  It's pathetic, I know.  The restaurant has pretty awesome ambience for a sports fan, big wooden tables and lots of screens playing ESPN or whatever big game is on.  I've come here for a couple games and stayed with friends to watch half a game.  The cheesesteak is fine (though I'd never choose it over the buffalo chicken).  I've tried "da Roc and Manuch", but it's just a bland marinara chicken sub.  The Godfather sounded promising, and normally I love italian-meat sandwiches, but it's just too heavy and the bread doesn't really work with this kind of sandwich.  Being my favorite place, I'm bummed to see so many poor reviews.  But they are mostly legit complaints.  The service can be pretty terrible, and it seems they only hire jerks to work the line.  The meals are expensive--it's like $12 for a meal with fries and drink.  But if you get the coupons and their occasional emails, it drops down to $5 for the same thing.  The delivery also does take a while, but whenever I'd have it delivered to work, I'd just make sure to order it an hour ahead and they're usually there when they say they'll make it.  Overall, it's a pricy place but you get what you pay for.  It's an original and unique place, definitely worth eating in at.

xWC2as3sOu-65Cpdb6vyKA.text: Despite 5 employees all with Philadelphia hats on, I'm guessing none of these Phoenicians has ever been to Philly and had a cheesesteak. They just could not get it right. The cheese was not at all mixed into the steak. The guy put it on like it was mustard or something. Hardly any steak either. I had to move half the steak onto half the bun and eat it or else it would have been all bread. Place is also dirty.

wJ8M8hc3qhswpOqoDKh-WQ.text: Being from Philly this shop wouldn't be open.  It is ok for Phoenix but a True Philadelphian knows a good cheese steak when they eat one.  There is barely any meat in the sandwich, little to no seasoning, the condiments are plenty by they don't  make up for the lack of substance of the cheese steak.

Kiv4bBZPkaxKcsW4Lz6lHQ.text: Would like to have rated the restaurant better, but unfortunately I cannot eat there as I am 5.2 miles away from Corleone's and there delivery radius is 5 miles. Nope, not kidding, called in for delivery, was asked for my address after a 2 minute wait, was put back on hold and the woman came back on the phone to tell me, "i am sorry, we dont deliver to your area". My response was, "uh, we are 10 minutes down the road, what is your delivery area?" Her answer "the delivery area is 5 miles, you are outside of it."  TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, COMICAL REALLY.

lt9vokfhei1b-8LhxQaxew.text: Pizza here is pretty good. Cheesesteaks could use some work though! Meat is not seasoned and bland. There also isn't much meat on the cheesesteak, which is especially disappointing given the price. Bottom line: go for the pizza but skip out on the expensive cheesesteaks, they aren't worth it!

0_PpfGe0HA0Wa0_4C8mErA.text: REAL DEAL Philly cheesesteaks! I only get the original wiz wit....Best I've had in AZ. I recently had a trip in philly and tried both Pats and Geno's. Corleones is right up there with them! Personally, I like Corleons better than Genos.   I took a couple of friends from Texas, today, and after a few bites one of them said to me " this is amazing! you just ruined it for all other cheesteaks!" Everyone else nodded in agreement, to busy to talk as it would ruin the moment.

hGhr7zfgN9QBKFvWFJP9Pw.text: Yum!! I always get the Italian hoagie and it's delicious and always piled high. I've eaten in the store as well as pick up and it's always consistent. I've only dealt with the male workers and they've always been very friendly to us. Everything here is very well priced which I love.

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian hoagie

xUu6XKOGqagyY0WRdcXTiQ.text: Eh.  I can't speak to their cheeseteaks, as I've only ever ordered pizza (always delivery, through GrubHub). The delivery times have always been accurate for me, and the food arrives pretty hot.  Their pizza is pretty basic. No this really flashy or high quality, just pizza for pizza's sake.  I found it odd, and kinda gross, that when I ordered bell peppers and onion on my pizza, it came with the same cooked-on-the-flat-top, limp and overcooked peppers and onions that would come on a cheeseteak sandwich. Does anyone else find this unusual? I get trying to save time and/or money by topping pizzas with their already-prepared veggies, but come on. Any place serving respectable pizza should have raw, fresh peppers and onions to top their pizzas, IMHO.  That said, their sauce is pretty good and the crust ain't bad. Pizza probably better suited to accompany some beers, and nothing you'd go out of your way for.

ejFe_lrcK2XSM6iiZB6XMg.text: One of the places I miss since I moved out of phoenix. I love the original cheesestake with cheese Whiz. And the specials could not be beat!

lPWyrtB-P5L72tKksLc6Fg.text: Another great pizza delivered in 30 mins, not the 60 that it quoted. Very happy again.

oAzNKCA6iiShYqIpk4IvDg.text: This is the best place if you want an amazing steak sandwich! We ordered the original steak sandwiches with fries and also a slice of cheese pizza. The pizza was okay and the plain fries with no cheese wiz were basic. I will tell you the steak sandwich is out of this world with grilled onions, a great amount of steak, and a cheesy flavor. This is just like being in Philly!

O6d1QTPVzOQXuOy-139iYg.text: The service is much less to be desired. Unfriendly and I accommodating. It is such a shame, the staff tainted the entire experience.

AnbvgLHU_TfWFEIPL0kvrg.text: I've been here twice both time the have been amazing love their service the guys are super nice and help you out with the order ! The sandwiches are super delicious KEEP UP THE GREAT FOOD &&&& service y'all !!

UIhyHvy_jlJ0aGLmGlEMPA.text: this was a pretty damn good food joint here.  honestly.  and instead of all caps, i'll do my review with no caps at all  * first of all, damn good meatball sub.  i spent 40 minutes in traffic on the 202, had enough, re-routed, ordered a meatball parm, shut down for a break.  the good news is, good meatball, good sauce, really good bread.  No, really pretty good.  I give it a 6.2...noticeably better than Subway.   because you really don't know how mediocre Subway bread is, and it's not bad, but you don't really know how mediocre it is until you eat better bread.  this is better bread.  not bianco bread, but better;  * the bad news is, there's no parm on this sandwich.  in fact, i'd be willing bet there's no "parm" anywhere near this joint.  define parm, buddy.  and if it's a meatball parm, that parm would be short for parmesan and there wasn't a shred of parm-E-San, it's not really a meatball PARM.  PLEASE DON'T ASK ME ABOUT THE WONDERS OF CHEESE-WIZ, 70% if their business.   * I asked for a side of sauce and was disappointed when it was given cold-how does that make sense?  why would i want cold marinara on what is supposed to be a pipping-hot sandwich? MAKES NO SENSE.  the friendly guy behind the line, kinda young, ball cap, thank you.  you were helpful, friendly, thank you.  the other guy?  older, facial hair...can i say f-you, you f-ing a$$?  what are you doing in the service business when clearly you hate customers?;  * THE SIDE STUFF: SWEET PEPPERS/SPORT PEPPERS ARE FRIGGING EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  (Far back of the restaurant) SERIOUSLY.  Hot, sour, sweet,   let me summarize this:  GIVEN: the meatball parm i got this day, the better-than-average-bread, along with these side peppers, the overall taste, flavor (same?) and price, I would go back.  Yes. now, lets discuss the Tuesday special: my Regular meatball parm, like, $8.00, on a Tuesday, after 4pm, I got any other sandwich same size for free.  See My Receipt!!!!  Again, this is a good sandwich, great price for the area or not, I'm gonna go back.  just gonna avoid the guy cooking anger than me.

XX7v1NGJnZ2DwyjH7CUzxQ.text: They messed up my order and I ended up getting 2 free pizzas from the mistake. Great customer service and delish!

vZNewAG0IXMEHaCrh7Gm9A.text: Ordered in from Corleone's tonight. I've never eaten there before, so I didn't know what to expect. Here is what was good:   1- ordering through the Yelp app was very easy and my order arrived earlier than scheduled and was delivered by a very nice person; 2- our onion rings were super crispy and wonderful and they accommodated our request for lots of extra ketchup; 3- our antipasto salad was simple and fresh and came with chips and a drink.  Not so good: We were going to share the buffalo chicken sandwich... but ended up not being what either one of us expected or enjoyed. It was finally minced chicken, smothered in buffalo sauce, and stuffed into soft hero bread doused in blue cheese dressing. The way they did the meat was just odd. Granted, the Yelp app did not provide any description of the sandwich beyond the name, and I chose to order it anyway, so it was my own fault for assuming that it was going to be different from what I received. Nonetheless it grossed us both out and left me feeling like despite the positives, I probably would not order from this restaurant again.

mMFbdNKj_3x4okd3LxN4MA.text: What do you expect when you order 2 slices of Pizza and your total is $13.30? Definately not a half done mediocre looking slice of Pizza. Go here if you feel the need to overpay. I got two slices of cheese pizza with the toppings thrown on top to where they weren't even incorporated with the cheese! Never going back there!

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Worst Slice of Pizza!

bBUj3TXA5_bb-xJgvXL3vg.text: Ok. Not sure if it was the food that made me sick yet or what. I ordered a hoagie. Not the turkey one... and it started out tasting really good. Then my stomach started to hurt and I didn't feel so good. Here it is the next day and my still a bit blah. This was my first time there. This was also a delivery order. It was pretty fast. But I dont think I will go back. Just the thought makes me a bit weary now.

K27b2XolxJxr8G-NmGvOSQ.text: Walked into this establishment and the girl standing at the counter was texting...didn't acknowledge me at all she proceeded to finish her text throws her phone down on the counter, and without making eye contact says "what can I get you" I decided to try this place anyway thinking let's see if the food is any better...it wasn't the cheese steaks are far from "authentic philly" and instead of real provolone or cheddar cheese this place uses cheese whiz ? As in the cheese you squirt from a can to put on you're crackers? Lolololol the fries are dry and taste old I thought the only good thing about this place is the how quickly the food came out...which I later found out why..I paid 16 dollars for a  Philly cheesesteak that was the size of a 6 inch sub from subway and fries that had no salt OH and a med drink spend you're money at the chipotle next door they food is always fresh you get a ton of it and their employees always have a smile on their face.

N3M1y3uhNl9fGTidAtTNAg.text: My husband and I ordered this via yelp delivery. I'm not sure whether that has something to do with the food we got but I'm not pleased. We ordered 2 sandwiches: the steak Italiano and the buffalo chicken. The first came without the onions I ordered and the second came without the ranch I ordered (it was literally just bread and chicken). I even went as far as requesting both the onions and the ranch on the side. What we got was extremely mediocre sandwiches. I gave 2 starts because it was food and it the sandwiches were eatable.    The french fries were cold, soggy and tasted like freezer burn. They were not accompanied by any ketchup to make them even minimally palatable. They went straight into the trash bin.   This 'meal' took a full hour to arrive (which yelp did warn us about). In short: I do not think it would be worth the gas or effort to drive to this place to get food, and its not worth a 60 min wait for delivery.

U1cTfy4JgLeWKoA6nRBhkA.text: I love this place and I order delivery from there at least 3 times a week. My most favorite place on earth.

kyo_mxcGyhZ29qtgAIWlgg.text: Excellent eats, service, and prices - give it a try! This was my first visit so I tried The Original and onion rings. Total cost of meal with drink $15. Ample meat and onion rings. Really tasty and fresh made. Can't speak highly enough of this place. Give them your phone number on first visit for extra 10% off. I can't wait to try their wings!

7cPP-45IttFqr0FHQkeCvw.text: I think the food was decent but it was 40 minutes after their promised time and we weren't given a warning or apology.. Nada.

7WH3ac8JYRRNLbVV3TRXhQ.text: Not to bad cheese steaks are good but little to greasy for me bread tasted a little off but good portion of meat but the people that work here are unfriendly or just no personality mite go back to try a slice

NYOsNomLnqDTDZMZ-stf0Q.text: love these sandwiches. its a little pricey if you order 'normally' but there are all sorts of specials to help with that-get on their email list!. when you can bring that price down, what you get is one of the better sandwiches from a chain around. the pizza is ok, nothing mindblowing, but still better than the likes of Dominoes or Papa Johns. same deal as the sandwiches- if you order at the right time, you can get a lot of pie for your dollars (and if you are inebriated and/or have lots of hot sauce, you will like it just fine!)

GyYEeuXoLTQl6NNDSQJylg.text: Disclaimer: the only other Philly cheesesteaks I've ever had were at sporting events, carnivals or airport/shopping mall stands. That being said, I was invited to Corleone's and was told I had to try the Cheesesteak since I never had an authentic one. I was not disappointed. I ordered it 'onions and whiz wit' despite the fact that I usually like really good cheese. I am a HUGE fan of what I ate. The steak is really good rib eye; not some cheap, fatty mystery piece of cow. That's why you're paying so much for the sandwich. There is a row of condiments that include oregano and red pepper flake shakers and peppers in vinegar. I added those to my sandwich too. The bread is fluffy and tender; easy to bite through. The meat is choppeed just right; it's tender and juicy. The Cheez Wiz... well, it's just good stuff in this sandwich. I never thought I'd say that, but if you haven't had it wiz wit, you gotta try it that way. You won't be disappointed.  The whole sandwich is an enormous order, but because I splurge on foods like this so rarely, I get the whole thing when I do. Like others said, I think the price is a little high, but man, I love these sandwiches.

w7SGaf7HvMTFQNvIcDAD7Q.text: The sandwiches are good as is the pizza...although a bit overpriced considering the quality.

GyTFn4dW1BZY2cUL5WG1mA.text: Hands down the best cheesesteak in town, period. Even the two east coast guys I went with said it was as close as they had gotten from home. That says a lot coming from these goodfellas I was out with for Lunch today...

YoE7axlHHX1HEdXMhCsxJw.text: Well I think I've had my sodium and sugar intake for the week. Great cheese steaks need great bread. And Corleone's delivers. I mean on the bread. Nice, soft and fresh. I have no idea if they actually deliver. Sliced rib eye meat, grilled onions and the sauteed mushrooms I added all held together by THE WIZ baby...I'm all about the WIZ. And I rarely drink soda, but was given a humungous to go cup and I filled it half with Hi C orange fruit punch (when was the last time ya'll had HI C?) and half with Sprite. Damn good. Damn good. Finished it all off with some decent fries and watched Headline News. Place was clean. Service was great.

rqNtImY_RKbiEInZvU8ItQ.text: My coworker/friend and I visit this little "gem" only once in a blue moon just because of the prices.  If we could go based solely on the food, we'd probably be there at least once a week.  The original philly cheese steak sub with cheese wiz is to die for, but man are they overpriced!!  You can't get out of there without spending over $20 on two people for lunch... for fast food, I consider that a little on the spendy side.

tv7Zl9OxSn7pO0Ku-frc3w.text: Ex-East-Coaster that I am, I am always looking for a good traditional pizza and a Philly Cheesesteak. 5 stars for the pizza here - just like I used to have growing up. 3 stars for the cheesesteaks -- good but not great, and a bit overpriced. I prefer Uncle Sam's, just up the 51 a bit, but I suppose that's just personal preference. Service is solid; last time I came in for take-out they burned my pizza, so they made me a new one for free. That's how you treat customers.

PzURj0AyRpQUx8jiT-xDDw.text: I'm all for Corleone's. Great cheese steaks in a nice atmosphere. I usually go with the original with provolone. I know, you're supposed to have Cheese Wiz, but I'm just not into processed cheese. The service is great and the people who work there are always friendly. Thumbs up to cheese steaks from Corleone's!

erLh8np7MgZ4ZFJ6XO19AA.text: If i could imagine how good a cheesesteak would be in Philly, this would be exactly it! Delicious!! I ordered a chicken cheesesteak and my partner ordered a classic Philly cheesesteak with all the fixin's. I was thoroughly satisfied with the service as well as the ambiance in this restaurant. Everyone was so very friendly and my food was made to order; just like I like it.

a5RwgxDDn90yXbm31rMS9g.text: Went for lunch with 2 colleagues and we all ordered different sandwiches. All of us ate every bite and commented that the food was really good. Plus, as we went for lunch, we were in and out in about 20 minutes. And the fries are really good!

crheBDbGmIwLCE1Wj7CV7w.text: My husband really likes this place, he likes the #1.  I think the fries are good.  I have had a pizza silce, it was ok.  I also found the service slow and unfriendly.

V-9xQoB3O6V8icyyVNI7Fg.text: After trying several cheese steaks in the area we found no need to continue our search the perfect, authentic "wit whiz" sandwich. By far the best this side of the continent

pV0yy-LAcqgaQF7lSDxMEg.text: I'm from philly and know what I'm looking for in a cheese steak.. Corleone's nails it every time...High quality ingredients (worth a little more) and great service..only problem is that they now have great pizza too so what am I supposed to do? Keep up the great work! See you for this weekends email special as usual

KyemY0kCMCXSJqOpQ6-fWA.text: I was not the one who ate here, i opted to go to Jimmy Johns next door, and according to my brother who did eat here, was the right choice. There were two orders in front of him which were already placed and it took them 10 minutes to then take his order of a Philly Cheese Steak, Onion Rings and a drink. By this time i had gone to Jimmy Johns, got my order, and walked over to CVS to pick something up, and walked back to Corleones to get my brother. We waited a few minutes and then his order finally came. I asked what his total was, almost $16!! They charged extra for Onions and Mushrooms (or peppers, can't remember) $1.49 each! These come standard on Philly cheese steaks and we know this because we lived in Philadelphia for 4 years with many real cheese steaks had that were WAY better and 2/3 the price!! My brother said it tasted good, but not for that price and he would have rather gone to Duck & Decanter, Wineburger (both down the road) or even Postinos just for some Bruschetta. If i were him i would rather just go up the road to the Rokerji's reverse Happy hour starting at 9 and get a glass of wine ($5), and their tip steak + Brei bruschetta bites ($5).

ajLH1w1gRTbwjRqcpu6N4w.text: My friend really talked this place up so I was excited to try it, but we both walked out disappointed. I had the Chicken Italiano which is marinated chicken with provolone, spinach, and grilled onions.  This portion of the sandwhich was actually really good, but the bread was awful!  It seemed like it had been pulled out of a freezer. My friend was also disappointed in his cheesesteak, inside and out. The fries were quite tasty though :)  For $9 a sandwich, give me fresh bread!

i6Cw-7g1SZljsHU2-G46Eg.text: placed an order for 15 lunch subs at 10:30 for delivery at 12:30.  1:05 still nothing.  called the restaurant and they said "oh sorry we processed the order for ONE instead of 15........................no phone call no discount no nothing...................awful service.  Sad thing is, i do a TON of lunch ordering for my call center and they wont be getting it

-0CivFwMVqToJpcJRJYG5A.text: Their sandwiches reminds me of cafeteria food in Junior high school.   Best used for a food fight.  Save your money and go to chipotles next door.

4S6nvZeDkrY3Jup7EdcI5Q.text: I love Corleone's!! We are huge fans of the authentic Philly Cheese steaks, especially with the Whiz. And you gotta try the onion rings! Mmm...

uQxXWCy4V-fVXOXKk2bYag.text: I love going to this place to get a Philly Cheesesteak sandwich. The prices are great.

s2L_r6lCER9j1ccpG9NLxg.text: Awesome cheese steaks and friendly service, what more could you ask for??

C5DLUW-j-IzxjvebkHkhrA.text: If your looking to fill your stomach, Corleone's is a favorite of mine.  While it's not the cheapest, it is worth it.  great for lunches or after a long night.    The first time I heard The Wiz it sounded like Cheeze Wiz but I was assured that it was much better than canned pressurized cheese...I was no mislead.

cEoiT23KFvVX7Y1krhlO4w.text: One of the best philly cheese steaks I've had.  Have not really had anything else from them, but when I order this is pretty much what I get.  They deliver and that is awesome!  Really great if you are looking for a philly cheesesteak.  They chop the meat up very small and diced though.

d6BWx7nr48iRy-V6Upul0A.text: I like this place, it's got good food that tastes authentic....or well, at least what I would think authentic would taste like. Their Philly Cheesesteak sandwich is really good and their fries are also quite tasty.  So why, you might ask, am I only giving it 3 stars? A couple reasons:  - Although it is a good sandwich, I think it is overpriced. If you want to get a sandwich combo, you're going to walk out paying 13 dollars. - The staff isn't particularly nice..they're not mean, but I wouldn't say they are nice. - And not that they did this on purpose, but I walked in and used a coupon once (which wasn't that great of a deal), ordered food, sat down, and saw a sign offering a special for that day that was WAY better than my coupon. I really wish the guy who rung me up (who might have been the owner) had mentioned it.  Conclusion: This place isn't bad and some people may feel it's 4-5 star good, I just don't feel it's worth the price.

ZHkVQyxxjMKHMifQ6syw2A.text: make sure you ask the guys at the counter for the $4.99 combo deal which includes a six-inch cheesesteak, yummy fries and drink. this deal is normally close to $10 so the coupon makes it a bargain.  their after 4pm $9 cheese pizza deal isn't bad either.  make sure you use the $4.99 for a dozen wing deal coupon too!

njbxsLdj8dAjanouFkDg4Q.text: Great cheesesteaks sandwich. I always love a cheesesteak but I hate getting fatty meat so I'm picky about where I get them, not one bit of fat in my sandwich here. Oh yeah,  I love the wiz on my philly. My girlfriend got two slices of pizza and loved it.  After 4 pm the have a large cheese pizza for 8.99. We got one a few days later and we got it well done and it was delicious. The staff is nice a friendly and pointed me in the right direction after asking a few ?'s. They deliver but of course Im a about a mile out of range but I thought I would mention it. Ill be back.

oQEntyaVwmeWrZH9vFZfvw.text: I'm surprised at the bad reviews. I have eaten at the Camelback location twice and the Mill location about five times. Every time it is great. The bread is so good! Soft, tasty, etc. The meat is so flavorful and juicy! Every time it is good! I always get the original. I have eaten at Forefathers once, and I prefer Corleone's! Much more flavorful! My Sister disagrees, but my Husband agrees. I recommend Corleone's! It is the best Philly I have had!   Oh, I almost forgot, the service! The service is amazing at Camelback, free extra cheese, etc.  The manager there is so friendly! The service at Mill has been hit and miss.  I gave five stars because it is the best I have had, but I have never been to the city to have the real thing, so I can not compare.

NBFMxuS-WCG-Pbzv36ToKw.text: I was craving a cheese steak and went to this place yesterday. One cheese steak was almost 10 bucks and I didn't get fries or anything with it (maybe that was extra) the meat in the sandwich tastes just like that frozen steakum crap you get at the grocery store and it was dripping with grease. Yuck! One of the guys behind the counter was kind of an ass too. I will never eat there again!

LEWYPa3dlWJNzpIWvL6u1g.text: After giving up on Luke's many months ago, I've been looking for a place to get my beef on. I'm not sure why it took me so long to build up my courage to try this place, but I finally ventured in today for lunch. While not the best sandwich I've had, this definitely fills the need. Juicy flavorful sandwich with super soft fresh bread.   The place is REALLY clean. They've only had 2 major health violations in the nearly 2 years they've been open. Most restaurants typically have 2-3 PER VISIT.   I had the 6" cheese steak with provolone and grilled onions. I loved that the grilled onions were thinly diced and not the typically stringy style. There was the perfect amount of them, not a heaping distraction from the great steak.   The fries were perfectly crispy (slightly overcooked, which I love) and hot.   The diet coke tasted great as well.   All this for under $10? Not too bad. I'll be back for sure!

BaqJJMZgL1uKf_xYJBoZOw.text: Waited an hour and a half for fries and a sandwich to be delivered. I live less than ten minutes away and the food was cold. Will not order again.

MLDgLRuoGs_CgnxVQGrYrg.text: Good cheese pizza and the cops that go there as customers adds an extra feeling of safety.

som5JspK2Tp3tf2mhvBXjw.text: Gotta try the Philly Cheesesteak wit Wiz. Yup- Cheez Whiz, the orange stuff from a can. It's a bit salty for my taste but not bad. I came here for lunch and against my better judgment, I went with the 6 inch....  Go for the foot long! (That's what she said.)   I also wished they gave me more fries with my meal, those are good. As I was leaving, there was an after 4 pm special so it may be worth trying after dark because unless you want to spend about $8 on a so-so Philly Cheesesteak sandwich, then go for it.   Overall, I would go again but not excitedly.

27YapdJp_5eGbCXwNru_Mg.text: I love the Philly sandwiches!! The fries with cheese whiz are amazing too!!

mpdudLscIdh9KJZvfkqjFg.text: they have a heart clogging philly cheese steak  sandwich with wiz as they call it which taste damn good had the chicken philly as well not as good this place attracts alot of dudes also serve pizza and a varity of other sandwiches

j-6huHuJ-TycvBP7smipVg.text: I'm a Philly girl who is always on the hunt for a great cheese steak!  You'd be surprised how hard it is to find a great sandwich, I mean is there really some great secret in Philly??  I do have to first say that Corleone's is pretty pricey for just a sandwich and a drink if there are no specials.  However, they definitely have the best cheesesteak in Phoenix.  My search still continues but Corleone's is number one in my book so far.

pT5yKW4yi_TS8Te7L6Qi0w.text: Love the food, love the service.  I take co-workers there all the time.  Hate the parking at lunch time.

1lJrM3fa9rY1YQXrs4fJYg.text: Will NEVER be back.  Apparently rudeness is acceptable service.  My friend went in to pick up our pizza, watched the pizza jockey pull and stretch a pie trying to get it of the board and into the oven.  When the cashier was asked if that was our pizza, my friend was told "I'm not gonna tell you that" and refused to answer direct questions.  I guess they have enough business that they don't need my business now or in the future.

pfCpf22u89WIjyQ_UCDzbQ.text: Corleone's is good. My favorite is the Chicken Italiano, but sometimes the chicken is too dry. The Original is great too. I like mine with provolone instead of whiz. Both the steak and chicken are lean and sliced thin. The staff is nice and helpful, but the prices are outrageous. Your receipt does usually have a coupon for $2 off your next order, but still...$9 for a half sandwich, fries & drink is a little much. The fries, though! Oh the fries...they are yummy!

BXw3Ww9JU55JqaFQFbeH7A.text: Cannot beat the 2 slice + drink for 5 bucks. Guys behind counter are nice and the food is good for the price.

VaBZ2a5pVmEK4p7V2RIxiA.text: Great Cheese Steak? Hardly, try to sell this is Philly and you would have customers out the door in a heartbeat. First, a cheese-steak need to have substantial roll. This one sogged out, they should use the real thing which is available through Sysco. An Amoroso's roll can stand up to all the juice. Second, this wasn't prime rib-eye, I don't know what cut it was, but is was tasteless. So was the rubbery provolone cheese. And last, it wasn't CLEAN.  Order the rolls on-line and get your butcher to slice you some rib-eye, homemade is better than anything I've gotten in Phoenix in years.

p2H7m_U7cA8MP9bFz4u_VA.text: There was this really mean girl working. She had black hair and she was so rude to my friend who didn't even know what was going on. If I could give 0 stars I would.

xrMKZUefFU2JxK-kP6jjjQ.text: We met a group of friends here for lunch and a couple are from the Philly area. We all enjoyed our sandwiches and had a great time. I'm glad the restaurant wasn't packed so we could easily move all the little tables together for our large group. It was a hopping place, so a lot of people must have been getting their sandwiches to go.

p-23144nkO1JBJ4YLPuqYg.text: Best deal for a Philly with Whiz! So tasty nice fries as well. I drove 30 minutes thru traffic to get a nice hot sandwich which was delicious. Thank you guys for making it taste great!

zRB8zoaQ27Azb-XNg8C7ZQ.text: FREAKING AMAZING! My normal spot in the west valley closed and I have been search for my fix and it hit the spot!

mIrVQiLvWhNJOPESxx0QfQ.text: The food is mediocre the place isn't very clean it's over priced and the staff is nowhere close to friendly.

OwUSVQcI1DaiGdc6g0BWdg.text: I was on my way into Jimmy John's when I decided to give Corleone's a shot. I ordered a basic cheese steak sandwich with provolone and mushrooms.   It took a little longer than expected, but it was a good sandwich with a generous amount of steak. Although it could have used more mushrooms. The hot and sweet pepper garnishes were also enjoyable.

7qd-sTw6XQr8hwW7POtojw.text: Hi could not believe I never been here before they got the bomb.com food.... I bet you $5 you will love this ish

Slnabz8XcesF9xtGksRBZA.text: I loved my sandwich but was bummed how dry it was. Since it was my first time ordering I may have ordered my sandwich wrong. Maybe next time I will ask for something to make it juicier. I also got bacon cheese fries. They were freshly done and awesome.  I am gonna try again and ask how to better order to get more how i expected it would be.  Beef was awesome bread was soft happy just need to modify order next time. Then i can upgrade to 5 star rating

eKvOsrGsdMnKW3LUz9zC7w.text: East coast represent in the west coast! So so so good! After living in Philly and vacationing annually to NJ this place felt just like home! Amazing Philly cheese steaks, pizza steaks, and hoagies! So good! Very authentic!!!!!!! Very kind service! The whole restaurant is decked out in Phillies and eagles memorabilia! Also they play all the Rocky movies all day long!

5Tk2GgZZmGK41tt2jNdxTA.text: I go to Corleone's at least twice a month, usually for dinner. I love the cheesesteaks and the staff is friendly. I went for lunch today and the girl taking orders was very rude and the drink/pepper station and dining area were both rather dirty.

_dEr1a9d_81QU6Ixul8F2Q.text: Ordered a dozen wings thru grub hub for the ASU/AZ college basketball game. First time ever using app. Specific instructions for wings. Sauce onside extra blue cheese. Wings arrive on time however no napkins and they gave me one ranch. Last time I place an order here.

HDMc0NIwZ3gWvEnjaTDDwg.text: Definite place to eat if you're down for some flavorful philly cheese steaks!! I always try to at least go there once a month if not more, the guys are always awesome and the place is clean and decorated to make you feel like you're in philly. I'd reccomend this place to anyone

kTcVFq4DrRTOGQQhCg-Z4g.text: You will love the Philly Cheesesteak Sandwiches I put provolone lettuce and extra mayo so it is not dry. The meat is so juicy and the bread is great. I live in Avondale and it is worth the drive or if there is a reason I'm in Phoenix my family and I will stop by for some awesomeness. They also have pizza and it is also the bomb of course not as bomb as these monster sandwiches.

tBhZsg8WhTjynPQx7cjDqA.text: It literally feels like you've crossed into Philly when you step through the door. The employees seem to have been flown in from that region of the country and the look of the place, it's theme, is very obviously designed to have that appearance. It's also about the only place in town I can think of to grab a cheesesteak, especially since the one in Tempe disappeared, and they're good cheesesteaks. I recommend going on a Tuesday, when they run their BOGO deal - then you can try one of their less traditional cheesesteaks, like the pizza one, which is worth a try.

C6hJtjNuX7QfKKmuBZTQyw.text: It's kinda expensive for a Philli cheesesteak sandwich combo reaching over my personal maximum budget of 15$, But then again you hardly see a place that uses real cheese whiz and  also offers fries with soda. Not good when you're on a budget. When payday hits this might hit the spot to enjoy a tasty phili cheesesteak.

cEzv0ABrLJjR1KwNWVHUVg.text: The most amazing Philly sandy in town. They are so good. From what they tell me they're original. A "Rocky" movie is always on along with sports. The pizza looks amazing. I'm trying to pry my hands off my Philly to have a slice. Bomb!

AkWg9B4QTIX79ml4iRVnhQ.text: Blech.... pizza is soggy and nasty. Subs are subpar and the place just looks grimy, please just pass on this.

njd0UQRWUWP9MPQD_UfgGg.text: Delicious! The OG cheesesteak is baller, great value for the money...  But, I meannnnnn....it's a serious fart factory if I'm being 100% real. I will d finitely eat here when horribly hung over and have at least 24 hours with the windows open....just sayin'

eGpJ-c_flA3nAHcaO6ZSfQ.text: Did you love Cheese Wiz as much as I do???  Best damn Philly Cheese Steak in North Phoenix. And the bread it comes on is soft and tasty.  I HIGHY recommend Corleone's.  Hope they open a location in Laveen one day cause Uber Eats won't come this far. Lol

uvolRXSs6CzGVa3SeXg5iw.text: Excellent service. Cheesesteaks are delicious. Huge pizzas with taste to match. Reasonable prices for the amount of food you get. This place had not disappointed since the day I first found out about it.

j8GnEvrYB8XimoztgXKypg.text: Kind of warm in there. Sun beats against the windows.  Great service when ordering. Ordered my birthday sandwich.  They allowed me to upgrade to a full sandwich.  Excellent rib eye and provolone sandwich, hot fries and large drink.

e-euLsDmm4izfy8dfJGGLA.text: As a fellow CheeseSteak Lover, I have to try it when I see it on the menu.  Not a fan here.  First, if you want me to come back, Why do you nickel and dime me as a customer?  That's just bad business.  $15 for my meal?  It's fast food!  Anyway, I'll sum it up...  No thanks.

fr5eDk1wyqpILYbGv2SHdA.text: Get chicken Philly with extra chicken, extra mayo and extra provolone cheese! Also try the meatball pizza, it's very good lol...

XRNakASxnkc29Vy_54ZaNA.text: Corleone's on camelback always hits the spot. They goofed up on one order (delivery) and when I called to complain they said they would immediately fix it. Seems like it's well managed.

Egx8UCIV6OCdqkRWZJ0BOQ.text: Ordered an original with whiz. AMAZING. Every once in a while I stray from my paleo diet to indulge, and it REALLY hit the spot today. *BONUS My order was delivered in 20 minutes, the driver was very nice (and cute too).* I would recommend this spot for anyone craving a philly. Yay! You guys rock!

cX5sFI5eo_2F3NBIOntteg.text: Just had the experience of a lifetime with my reading class.On this field trip, my students got to work the grill, creating their own cheesesteaks. They are still raving about the opportunity and the food. Everyone in our party was also treated to their own, cooked-to-order sandwich. Little Joey is the best!

fKXvAQYDHvAG1L_9S4iChA.text: I wasn't impressed. The meat on the Philly was flavorless they nickel and dime you for mushrooms, peppers and onions. The cook had a problem with his spatula when he wasn't cooking he was banging on the grill making music which was very annoying.

gYZ0_KZbui92Iyj3WQEkYw.text: Since we came back from Italy we haven't found pizza decent enough compared to the real thing but This place comes close. Their french fries are also good! And they are quick

ceRk_nhVhU4omU7FENmUvg.text: Delish buffalo chicken sandwich, the little joey's cheesesteak with cheese wis was amazing too. Will definitely try them again!

zD9El0HELBwkFp2JgWeHEw.text: Alright, I see this place has gotten a half and half of good and bad reviews...what I want to say is that if you do not like this place then you do not like eating...period. "I don't like processed cheese" or "the buns aren't good enough"...wtf? Like I said, if you don't enjoy the pure pleasure of good food regardless of whether or not they have the buns 'you remember from the old days' then you are not a foodie. I ordered the Original Regular size and should have ordered 2 of them because they were sooooo good!! I ride a bike everyday to school about 10 miles everyday...when I need to eat I need to eat and this place delivers with outstanding service and food. If you don't like Corleone's cheese steaks then you don't deserve a Corleone's cheese steak...period!

TRV7_gTTkWITjq2xhMglrA.text: Yo, ya gotta be freakin kiddin me!  Why is it so hard to get a decent cheesesteak in AZ?  I know there are tons of you Phili invaders out there.  Can one of you open up a cheesesteak spot that is original, delicious, at an affordable price?  I've been to Corleones a dozen times or so.  The only reason I go back is b/c there are no real other options.  You are talking a 3 at best flavor wise cheesesteak for $14+ if you get fries, and a drink and leave a tip.  What a rip off.    The guys here are always cool but the price vs product just doesnt make any sense.

lM5XYuKw9p0APKHxFTm5xg.text: This is review is based on my experience with their delivery service. After several orders of pizza and wings, I have not been disappointed! I love this style of pizza- thin crust, light on the sauce, powerful cheese taste. The wings were yummy as well. Only complaint is that it took a while to get the food (longer than I was told on the phone) and the second time it arrived less than lukewarm.

wiUXV5MuZiadjuxWxHKBcA.text: I absolutely love this place!  By far the best cheesesteaks outside of Philly...hands down!  The rolls are perfectly soft, the whiz is the authentic best and the meat is just right.  Super friendly staff, clean restaurant...and good pickles too!

MWtGmlur81YZ3Ry9KBmX4g.text: We ordered delivery. The estimated wait time was 45-60 minutes (a bit long for delivery imo) and they were 15 minutes late. The french fries were soggy and tasted a bit stale. Even re-heated, they weren't good. However, the sandwich made up for everything. I had the meatball marinara sub with provolone and jalapenos and it was delicious. I'd be willing to try this place again, but not through delivery again. Carry out only.

Y4AsK8efxb2otaTMmc6-gw.text: I ended up here on a recent Friday by accident.  My first stop for cheesesteaks is now closed (apparently for awhile) so I was kind of rudderless.  Drove around for a bit until I saw Corleone's, and since I was in a cheesesteak mood, headed on it (it also helped that a sporting event that I wanted to see was on at the time and I knew they had tv's).   I'd also been to the Corleone's in Scottsdale in the past, and had remembered liking it.  I ordered the large philly (whiz witout) and no fries (though from the past, the cheesefries are great) since as a general rule (which failed this time), it's usually best to save the stomach room for the cheesesteak, rather than add on the fries. The food came out in a suitable amount of time, and I didn't think I was deliberate in eating it...however towards the last 1/4 of the sandwich, the meat/cheese was already getting cold, it was kind of weird.  Anywho, I ate the whole thing (note:  $10 is probably a little pricey, I think they must know this, as I got two coupons from them while there, one for $2 off next time, one for BOGOF).    Fast forward a few hours later, and I'm at my desk with food baby from stuffing myself.  Stupid me for eating so much was my initial thought.  Except that my tummy was unsettled for the next two days.  Now...I can't say for sure that it was Corleone's...but I'm pretty sure, so not too pleased about that.  I mean, if the sandwich had been good, it totally would have been worth it, but it was ok, and not a great value.  Not sure if I'll be back.  2.5 stars, only rounded up because my prior experiences in Scottsdale were better than here.

RbuzKOWUhA06QkC5L6Wchw.text: Pizzas are good. And it ends there.  Service with a smile is an unheard of concept... I get the east coast "attitude" thing but i think here its more of "when is it closing time" for these employees.  I was charged for xtra toppings on my cheesesteak and when i got the sandwich... No toppings!  Then it was an argument with the cook so i had to bring my philly up to the line to SHOW him there were no toppings!  Overpriced... Bad customer service... But free delivery... U decide.

AWYSCl6KBQ_uhyksImnPLQ.text: I like using this place for their slice of steak and maybe a drink for about $3.60 as either a decent lunch or  to take it home and have it with a salad for dinner. It's a cheap and quick meal and tastes really good. The fries are pretty above average too. The people who take your order behind the counter are pretty gruff, but they consistently deliver a good product and have seen them be accommodating to other customers by wiping down tables for them and apologize they were less than clean so that really impressed me.

V49PW6bhn7k-Y-kjzmTdgg.text: Yo, Youse guys better hit up dis joint if you know whats best for you.  According to their t-shirts, New Times likes it.  What other proof do you need?  Okay, okay.  I give it my stamp of approval too.  Here we go.  Great Philly's... They call 'em cheesesteaks, I call 'em philly's... Who cares.  Watch out though, they'll dump a bunch of cheese whiz on your sandwhich if you don't ask for provolone.  Oh, also... if you want peppers on your philly, you have to ask for it.  Great service!  We even changed our order at the pick-up window and they had NO problem fixing it!  Fries were great with the supplied... wait for it... MALT VINEGAR! Yay!!!!!!  They have state of the art ice tea machines that make you feel like a rocket scientist when you use them.  The provolone is mixed in with the steak before they put it in your buns (ouch!) so it is nice and meltilicious...  The decor is godfather meets rocky balboa with a twist of 1920's depression. Yes, yes... it IS industrial decor like all the new chains, but it fits!!!!!  Thinking of going somewhere else for a philly? Fogettaboutit!

rC3E_0xKs3DZrQMw_fmmpQ.text: Excellent food especially Philly Cheese SteaksMediocre customer service. I've called in an order and people have kept me waiting for 4 to 5 minutes. Ive hung up, waited another few minutes and then have taken my order in a rude manner. Overall this company has great food and horrible customer service. NOTE TO CORPORATE: Train your franchises and owners to have way better customer service this probably would have grown your business faster......

2jZO6x1jZKQVv2jdItn7qg.text: Have been here a few times and every time it has been good the staff is nice and the food is quick. It is well worth the 30 min drive to they there.

I saved the salad for lunch the next day and it kept really well. I stopped in here a handful of years ago for a philly and it was just as good as I remember. I'll definitely be checking out more of the menu ASAP!!

When I opened it I found that I got some sort of shredded chicken instead. Not what you want to find after you drive 40 minutes home.  The food is usually good, but I guess I need to check my order before I leave from now on.

rVBkGu_mwbZw3YiA50X5BQ.text: Best Philly Cheesesteak this side of Philly!  The homemade bread is fantastic with the steak, hot Cheez Whiz, & grilled onions. That sandwich practically melts in your mouth!  I don't know what they do to their fries, but they are delish!  I drive 30 miles just to get my cheesesteak.  I only wish they would open one in Surprise!

Bsy34cTvHcCOjlb5QuVWiw.text: Masterful cheesesteak. Don't skip the WIZ!  Fries are great as well. Nice spot to post up outside if the weather permits. Overall quality cheesesteak. Would say the lot is a bit crowded but it is a hot spot.

W1r1Yurgbz0u1rarDGXgeQ.text: With the Eagles playing today and being married to a philly native we were destined to eat a cheese steak today! Must be good luck.. right?! This was my first time to Corleone's. I never felt so stupid till I try to order... wiz, wit, witout, with what!??? Lol I just look at my husband like please just order for me, it's cool. Haha I got it down now though so next visit I'll be a big girl.  I got the original philly cheese steak wit onions, green peppers, wiz, and toasted. HOLY AMAZINGNESS! The wiz was creamy and delicious, the meat was tender, and bread had the perfect crunch with being toasted. I might even get extra wiz next time. We also got the buffalo chicken with ranch and mozzarella. It's was very good yet super messy. Not too Spicy. We each got a combo with regular fries and cheese fries. The fries are super good and have the perfect crisp. The cheese fries were amazing!  Few tips I learned today: 1. Get extra wiz so it's layered on top.. mmmm 2. Toasted bread 3. Cheese fries. Yum! 4. Add grilled green peppers  They do have a pickled pepper bar to add to your sandwich in addition if you like that. I'm not crazy about those sweet papers but my husband likes them.   Overall everything was very tasty and I'm excited to come back. Friendly and quick service. I really liked the philly/eagle decor in this shop. Makes you really feel like your back in philly with the atmosphere and food. You know your married to a philly guy when their 20reasons your from philly sign all applies to my husband and his family. Haha! Now for the game today.... Go Eagles!!!

HSclTzeGxiMx6p8yyfDBsQ.text: Glorious cheese whiz, oh how it has been missing in my life until now! My dad and I have been on a sandwich/hoagie kick lately and decided to give Corleone's a try...boy are we glad we did!   On arrival we were warmly greeted by the staff and a pretty cool environment. There were giant pizzas on display that looked delicious, and the smell of steak fries wafted in the air. The restaurant is not fancy by any means, but it makes you feel like you are in Philly. Rocky movies are playing on the TVs and there are pictures and signs all over relating to the city; it's a fun upbeat atmosphere.   After much deliberation over the menu we went with a buffalo chicken hoagie and an original cheez whiz cheesesteak. They gave us a number and we headed over to get fresh peppers and condiments at the little bar area they have set up. Something about free peppers makes you feel giddy inside. We waited a while for our food but it was obvious they were making it all fresh to order. The fries that I smelled walking in looked amazing, next time I'm getting fries! Our food arrived hot and ready to be devoured. My dad enjoyed his buffalo chicken and I loved my original with cheese whiz. Holy smokes I need more cheese whiz in my life!   Corleone's isn't exactly cheap, but it doesn't break the bank either. We enjoyed our food and experience and will be back to try more goodies on the menu!

3VXXstTUKMFBJVNst4_lYg.text: Hands down the best cheesesteak I've had in the valley. It's all in the meat. It's actually flavorful and not bland like everywhere else. Go here. You won't regret it. Oh and their fries are the bomb too. Pure fire baby. Just go here already will ya?!

45q6kI81ttTIng3uPNuanQ.text: Great food, the place can use a definite wipe down. There is a layer of grime almost anywhere you look. But the food is great and the prices are reasonable. They are obviously busy making bomb food, but a wipe down would do wonders!!

qJqzKRMnD2UgrNaFhBA9CA.text: Great food but the girl at the counter could use a personality adjustment. Rude and unprofessional.

k8_RTNXSqS2gwnimGtUtlQ.text: This place has good cheesesteaks and pretty good pizza. I also tried their wings for the first time last week and their wings were pretty good too. I ordered mild (although I usually order medium) and they actually tasted like medium - a little on the spicier side. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try.

S9wSvqm1tEnxUjIu0orTAQ.text: I really like this Philly cheesesteak. To have provolone cheese and such is really nice.  I've always liked cheesesteak but this one of the best. Really good service. Place is clean.

KVeCwZEBoxbPI1RNgvDpSg.text: These wise guys really know how to make Philly Cheesesteak. OK, I have been to South Philly and all the way to 9th and Passyunk Ave. That is where the Philly started and Geno's and Pat's are still contending.    The secret is in the bun and the meat. As a Philly purist, I always want provolone cheese on mine. In Phoenix, Cheez Whiz is the main option. This joint wants to charge extra for green peppers, in Philly they come standard.     Our two Philly Cheesesteaks were great despite their use of Cheez Whiz. This is a good choice in Phoenix for Cheesesteaks.    The French fries were just average. That means my fav Five Guys still make the best fries.   This place is busy on weekend evenings. Get there early for your PHX Philly.

0xBJxBaPjS9Wqs-KOH1QRA.text: First time here and it was amazing! Friendly staff, quick service.  I ordered a small Philly cheese steak (rib-eye) with mayo, onions, peppers, and provolone cheese & fries.  The small looked like a large it was so filling, the meat, cheese and peppers were all cooked to perfection.  French fries were a little over cooked but still super yummy! I'll definitely be back.. Looking forward to trying the chicken philly!

5j1HLnggmK9JWVdUZDHLGQ.text: Love the cheese whiz and the BEST fries!!! We love coming here for our dates and pigging our while watching Rocky!

_z-Le4j7sCmm7Oq80rLaZg.text: Ever since I tried this place about a month ago back I've found myself going almost every week. My wife and I split a regular size Original and get their delicious fries on the side. Have tried their pepperoni pizza and can honestly say it's justas good as the Philly cheese steak. Love this place and recommend to anyone.

a3laI_pTbAvJVvaWEpPnhw.text: This was one of the best Philly's in AZ I've ever had.  The authenticity was on the mark.  It's a great place for kids and cheap eats.   Try the classic Philly first and the bacon cheddar fries.  You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Philly and Bacon Cheddar Fries.

R9ZLJJMqZP5qwrAAXUWVBA.text: I don't even normally LIKE philly cheese steaks- but the sandwiches here are AMAZING! They put cheez whiz on them. WHAT?! I know, sounds completely revolting, right? Turns out it isn't. I though cheez whiz was E-Z Cheez. Nope, it is something completely different. Combine that with the grilled onions, and perfectly grilled steak chunks? Hello taste bud meltdown experience.    And the Cheez Whiz fries with grilled onions? HOLY Mother of God are those GOOOOOD! I don't even want to take a guess on what the caloric intake is on either- but if you don't care, or only want to eat once that week anyway- take a trip to Corleone's. You won't regret it. (Well, you may if you don't wear your stretchy pants when you go)

7z2ElDNP7N2Ir0SHsJI1dQ.text: tl;dr version:  Corleone's will spam your cell phone mercilessly if you give them a real phone number to work with.  Some people probably don't mind this, but I sure as hell do.  Don't get me wrong - the food is alright and their delivery is fairly reliable, but all of a sudden they've decided to go all-out with an unbelievably intrusive marketing 'strategy'.  I've ordered from them about once a month for the past 5 months, never signed up for any 'loyalty' (translation:  "Sell my personal details and spam me mercilessly") program, nor given them any permission to contact me for anything other than the particular order I've placed.  As of today, I've started getting unsolicited txt messages (3 today within 2 hours) from Corleone's telling me that I've been automatically signed up for their 'spam my phone' service and then asking for personal details like birthdate - allegedly so I can get some birthday bonus or whatever.    In my world, Corleone's now sleeps with the fishes - I'll get my pizza and cheesesteaks elsewhere from now on.

DemOFW8XzVlTM6nL6B6vxw.text: Worst customer service ever. Ordered online took over an hour to arrive and still arrived wrong. They called to tell me that they were out of chicken nuggets a half hour into my order. Which was fine, then 25 mins after that I get another call asking what drinks were ordered. Finally the food arrives after an hour and 15 minute wait. It was cold and completely wrong. I called back to tell them of the mistake and The so called "manager" gets into an argument with me saying the order was correct and the best he could do was 20% off my NEXT order. No offer to fix or replace so I tell them to pick up the sandwich and just refund me and I get into another argument saying he can only refund minus the tip because he would be in the negative. Seriously, OVER A FUCKING CHEESESTEAK. 15 mins he calls back and says I voided the card for you. What a joke. I would never order from this place just off the fact that if something is wrong you have to pull teeth just to get your money back. A simple sorry and a refund or an offer to send the proper food out would have been nice. Instead they want to make everything difficult and argue with the customer.   Working in customer service myself I have learned that in no circumstance should you argue with anybody. It's just common sense.  I've refunded people for a lot more than a shitty 12.00 sandwich without blinking or arguing. I know if I didn't I would get fired. But then again I could always apply at Corleone's and tell every customer to fuck off and be just fine. There is definitely a reason to this location is getting 3 stars overall.

mufjgtTPIUwNVnN3T4Z93Q.text: Amazing costumer service as I walk in to enjoy my delicious Philly cheese stake and pizza made by Jorge thanks !

m03PhjPR_GvAIioILH3p8A.text: I've been ordering (delivery) from Corleone's for some time now and every single time the food is pretty good, fresh and hot. Their cheese steak sandwiches are quite good. I'm always looking for reliable food delivery and this place does deliver every single time.

8lgdsvcGOeUx_894AUIRoQ.text: Long wait it took forever for them to come and take my order then it took forever for them to make the food they forgot the onions and no peppers this place isn't what it used to be :(

X4SbifVN4CNHbeVW9oOUbg.text: Cheese Steaks!  That's what they do ... place looks like a bar (but no liquor offered) ... very clean ... very nice ... GREAT Cheese Steaks ... with Cheese Wiz and the buns rock!!!
