prLec2gmqpmqp58fG-kzYQ.text: I've ordered from Corleone's online via Eat24 three times and had similar experiences each time.  I'm not sure why I gave it a second and third chance, but I did.  I even waited until after I ate to let my hunger subside before writing this review.  I placed my order this evening, received the confirmation, and was surprised to see a 45-60 min. wait for delivery.  Considering I ordered two sandwiches, which, at best, take 10 mins. to make, it seems like a long wait, but not unreasonable.  However, tonight, as was the case with my first two orders, it took an hour and a half for my food to be delivered.  When it arrived, the sandwiches were cold and a bit soggy.  Not surprising given the fact that they were likely sitting in the restaurant for an hour and 20 mins.  Each time, they've claimed to be shorthanded with delivery drivers that night.  But 3/3 times over a period of months?  It may be time to hire more delivery drivers.    Avoid this place (for delivery, at least) unless you want to wait until the point of hanger and then eat cold, soggy sandwiches.

iqlEI2w93XPwif59eR6Idg.text: "OK-OK-OK!"  If you are on a diet most definitely this is not the place for you!  If over paying for a Philly Cheese steak, they call it "a large," I was wanting more when I finished my Sandwich, again not the place for you!!!   However if you want to walk into an authentic Mafioso looking deli-restaurant with a sandwich, an epicurean delight, that will give you multiple foodgasms than "Yo, how you doin'!"   All I'll say is that the smooth taste and texture of the Philly Cheese steak sandwich was incredibly flavorful, and beyond delicious! Enough to have your eyes roll back in your head and possibly shout "this is so fing good!!"   When you walk in this joint there is a large profile picture of Don Corleone, Marlon Brando, with the words;  "Make 'Em A Sandwich They Can't Refuse!"  Now that's a Slogan!   They even have a real Pickle Bar with banana peppers, hot peppers, and homemade salt pickles. I loved it!!!   "Bing, Bang, Boom!" I scarfed mine down and I wanted more.

5kUCObduFzQnMB-D-WdWsA.text: Automatic soap dispenser but a manual paper towel machine... Make up your mind!! Are you pre-2010 or not?

DWOT_DbdxDf2gdJy3-Jf6g.text: *edited  When I wrote my original review I was hangry.  Waiting 2 hours for a food delivery order will do that to you.   I eat here often as the 16th street location is near my work.  The food is usually pretty good. If this were a dine-in only review I would probably give the place 3-4 stars. However this review also takes into account my one and only online delivery order and that brings the score down quite a bit. Today, I was stuck at work over my lunch break so I put in an online order for delivery. The confirmation came back and said it would be 1 hour, which I thought was a long time since the sandwich takes 10 minutes and they are only 8 blocks away. (Jimmy Johns is right next door to them and they are usually here within 20 minutes, different restaurant, I know!)  Anyway, 1 hour came and went, then 1h30m, finally at 2 hours my food was delivered...or someone's food was delivered.  My sandwich was wrong (asked for no onions, got onions, asked for iced tea, got soda, asked for side of cheese wiz for my fries, got none).  The fries were cold and soggy also. I called the restaurant right away.  After talking to an employee for a few minutes, he gave up and transferred me to the manager.  He offered to remake the food and send it back out, but having already waited 2 hours I asked for a refund instead.  *long pause...okay, I'll refund your card.  I am giving back a star for the willingness to correct their mistake and refund me. So long story short, dine in, don't get delivery, you will be much happier with your meal.

nNr054MISjg9Sv6R0_06kA.text: Pizza is good, but not at all remarkable. Lunch specials are a good value, and Philly sports memorabilia is fun to peruse. United Mileage Plus dining participation is also a plus.  In the end, there are a plethora of pizza options in the area I like much better.

SWQYElbNXzx07zzDBxqNnw.text: Great Pizza and Philly Cheese steaks. I'm a big fan.

-g_6AlD_i7-DrHticxB1hw.text: For a phlilly cheese steak place to use canned mushrooms and charge u 50 cents for them is crazy .... no one here had a smile on their face it seemed as if everyone here was pissed off to serve me and take my order never coming here again...

5x7r0puSl2wCA7J7HDFYQg.text: If you like hamburger helper, order yourself a Philly steak with cheez whizz. Not only did my sandwich take an hour and a half to be delivered a fifth of a mile, it's contents were no better than re-heated, leftover hamburger helper mush. DINE-IN

pc_5N9WoxiuQiZaETeO8cg.text: I tried the pizza for the first time today. I had the $4.99 two cheese slice special with a drink. It's a decent value as the slices are quite large. However not much flavor to the sauce or the pizza in general. The crust despite being properly cooked with appropriate browning on the bottom just seemed to lack substance. It seemed to just disappear in my mouth rather than being chewable. It's a decent value for the money, the place was clean and the service was quick enough. I wouldn't go back for the pizza.

LHwTFjHA7SywU5YSDP9OLA.text: I order from here at least once a week using Eat24, and I have never had bad service, or the wrong order. The staff seems responsive and respectful. Plus the food always great!

77FCYgSZ7zkjv8VqDxVEWA.text: Corleone's have great Philly Cheese Steaks but they will run you about $6.50 and if you add fries and a drink that will run you another $2.50 and it with tax you are talking about $10 for one person to have lunch.  They do have a great lunch special at this location two slices of Philadelphia pizza and a drink for $4.99.  I have yet to try that but from what I seen the slices are huge and are good ( per a co-worker of mine ).

1OkL68rw0usm6pR23S_1Kw.text: My fiance has been talking about this place for the last few months. He regularly frequents this place for lunch with his co-workers and has been waiting for the day that I got to try it too. Well, the day came when he brought a pizza from Corleone's home for dinner. Short story is that I LOVED the pizza so much that I demolished 3 whole slices - and their slices are not small.   I have yet to try their sandwiches which seem to be their specialty but the fiance loves them and he was right about the pizza so I'm sure I'll be happy once I get my chance to taste test.

DXqU1nDbDov8Wh2u6dBARg.text: Philly cheese steaks are good, the bacon cheese and steak and cheese fries are basic. I made my order for delivery at 5:38 they didn't show up until 7:30. They called me to tell me they didn't have enough bacon for 2 bacon cheese fries like 40 mins after I made my order, lol it's always funny when a business "runs" out of stuff. Overall it was ok I wouldn't bother going back again.

CrxCIBdtPEkINfBO9LD1_Q.text: I go here about once a month. As far as cheese steaks go they are very good. Get the one with whiz and onions! Here is where I have a problem, the customer service is horrible.  When you walk in they don't greet you. They just look at you and wait for you to say something. They never smile. Everyone working looks like they hate their life. A simple hello, a smile, and a thank you when I give you my hard earned money is all I ask. I hope they improve or I will find another place for cheese steaks.

gntpJSkg0_v43QxFZvjVAA.text: This place is great.  Really good pizza and lunch specials. The staff is always super friendly!  The atmosphere is fun for a pizza parlor and its local reputation is super positive. I know businesses around that area that eat here religiously.

hVdL6QslyNRy8NdOk7Dptw.text: I love this pizza. The staff is also always on point. I've tried many pizza joints in AZ, this is definitely in my top favorites. The wings are really good too. I wish they were still on GrubHub. Whoever the owner is, they are hiring the right people. I'm always welcomed and my order is made quickly. This is the type of place where you look for the tip jar.

W15cz_Hir9k6dopS0q1GAw.text: I'm always on a mission to find a great philly cheesesteak. No luck in years. Closest I came to a good one was at a pub in Scottsdale called Clancy's.   The steak had no flavor and tasted waterlogged. Putting cheese whiz didn't add as much flavor as a real cheese would have.   Bacon and cheese fries were also a disappointment. They were lacking substance and all the cheese melted and stuck to the bottom of the plate.   I ordered through grubhub and the service was okay. They were punctual and friendly, but that about all they had going for them.   I had high hopes for this restaurant and they fell short. More power to them for being in business for so long.

mHaPp0BUFEJipzKxZ2zWFg.text: I haven't been to Corleone's in almost a year, but I was thinking about sandwiches and remembered how much I liked Corleone's, so this review is a bit overdue.   First time I went I remember thinking "Cheez Whiz on a sandwich?" but I was told to try it before I complained and I did. I used that same spiel on my mom when I took her and she frowned at Cheez Whiz being on her sandwich. Needless to say, we were both wrong. The Philly Cheese Steak at Corleone's is amazing. They also have really good fries and that's pretty much the only two things I've ever eaten there in spite of having been there probably a dozen times. Even if you're apprehensive, go and give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

-zKpiKElIF_PpvW3XVkSOg.text: We've eaten here at least 3 times already in the last couple of months! My wife and I love it! Haven't had Cheese Whiz since I was a kid, so its kind of special. My wife brought me the cheesesteak fries last night. My life is changed! I have a new appreciation for Corleone's now. Its so good, it will have you licking the cheese off of the tray paper (if you are a True Cheese Whiz fan). Of course, we had the cheesesteaks as well...don't tell me how many calories were in both the big cheesesteak sandwich and the cheesesteak fries...I'm having at the present point not knowing. I'll exercise later today!  Just know their food is EXCELLENT! I need to plan a trip to the top cheesesteak places in Philly one day for a comparison, but in my book, Corleone's is top notch!

uRJSxsuqLq_R4__hqQScUQ.text: Cheesesteaks rock... meatball subs even better!!  Make sure you check this place out!  Good food/good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kiki approves of their french fries!  Nom...nom...nom...

O3-VtBoMqDe9ts7uUO-7Bw.text: I was born and raised in Philly. Absolute BEST cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly...EVER!

yJ_hcvmPcojWasOVImATqg.text: Call Corleone's only if you have two hours for delivery. The online order response told us 50 minutes. Horrible manager on duty. We called. Told us at 60 minutes the driver was in the car. Told us at 110 minutes that driver left 15 minutes ago. One of those has to be a lie, right?  Told us "Online says it's 50min but really it is 90min."  Food arrived 2hrs late. On dot. They never tried to update us or treat us honestly, just kept feeding us lines. Kept calling me "boss" which I wish were True. Driver was nice enough and hustled, said he wasn't even a driver but instead a cook. Don't know who to blame. But I know we won't be calling Corleone's again. Or going in person.

Being from the East Coast though I am not convinced that they are accomplishing their goal of east coast style pizza. The crust is soggy and not crispy like I am used to. mG3LPqnH8BB3h52UgRDyOQ.text: I see a lot of complaints about delivery, but I don't really think that's Corleone's fault. Their food is absolutely delicious for philly cheese steaks.

-q2HRXOtAjb_Am2uiGACGQ.text: The BEST Philly Cheese Steak in the valley! They actually use the correct ingredient that most places don't use....CHEEZ WHIZ! And of course you gotta get it wit grilled onions! They are always quick and have some really great specials. They also have some of the best French fries, of course I get the cheez whiz on that and it's even more delicious!!!! I will continue to come here!

mEmUFxJKZPgJ2q1JJI02aw.text: A friend took me there two years ago while on business. Was awesome then, and still is. This time I brought my son with me. The people that work there are great and the music is fantastic. Hopefully it won't be another two years to get back.

cc_6pFUFQN1pZsIrBYZMvQ.text: Great NY style pizza!!! It's about $15 for a large cheese and it's well worth it!!! The pizzas are very large and very delicious!!! The staff was very friendly, and the environment was nice and clean. I'd definitely go there again!!

E9PoelOOhp6S9JWDwZO4YQ.text: Cheesesteaks, chicken cheesesteaks, cheese fries, pizza and wings are always great. Drivers are friendly, and the food always shows up fast

UY4_I_WwgHcZBzX_Tj7cnQ.text: Wish I could give zero stars. They were very rude when I came in on my BIRTHDAY to redeem a free small sandwich. I presented the coupon on my phone which is what it states on the coupon on my phone to do to present to server nothing else. Additionally I was also gonna order a lot of other food for my family. They said it couldn't be redeemed because it had to be printed out to get it free, even though it didn't state that ANYWHERE and it had a bar code and could show my ID that it was my birthday. It should be clearly stated if that is the restaurant policy before people go out of their way to go to that place. They were rude about it and couldn't explain why it wasn't listed or at least put a sign up at the register stating that. They need to work on customer service, both employers had attitude and the girl was rolling her eyes. Make all the promotions very clear before sending them out so your customers are not inconvenienced.

At2FXVCtm6OzN8eN_mSGQw.text: The food is oversold but the price is right and the staff is nice. 60% of me going back. just because I l live in the area. 4 stars.

eEqWdERiguHq0rXe-rOmlg.text: The staff is horribly rude. We placed an order through Door Dash. When the delivery driver called us to confirm that part of our order was unavailable, she said that the restaurant had already notified us. No one had called us from the restaurant. The restaurant told our delivery driver that they called to notify us of the items that were unavailable and "fixed everything".  That was a lie. When I called the restaurant to ask them about this, the girl who answered the phone was insanely rude. I told her that no one had called us about the order and she replied "Oh, so you know how we work. Do you work here then I guess?"  That's amazing customer service. Congrats. Hire new staff

Ow6a04HZLf2uFSsx8tib4w.text: Great sandwiches. Awesome thin crust pizza. Friendly, fast, fresh, quality ingredients, clean. Reasonable prices.

Qwgb_hT_GKWzE-rQz3IJlw.text: I love this place. Their pizza is amazing! I just wish ordering delivery didn't take an hour or more. I've recommended this place to others multiple times!

BS6o_T3tG5veC4Yljl0pJg.text: Torn on this one because usually it is much better. However, this last time left me less than thrilled.  Came towards the end of lunch, the place was packed. There were a lot of campers, so really not a place to sit, and there isn't much room to start. Perhaps they had some sort of A/C issue because they had some huge...like HUGE fan/external cooling unit thing sitting in front of the bathroom hallway.  There were 4 people in front of us and it took about 20 minutes to get our food, not so good if you are in a hurry...and we were.  We ordered two cheesesteaks and an order of fries to share... fries were $2+ and barely got a handful, felt pretty ripped off frankly. Even more so after the wait when I took a bite to find out the fries were lukewarm at best. sigh.  I am hoping this was an off day and not a sign of change.  The food is delicious and the fries are (usually) worth craving...   I'll be back, hopefully I will have a more positive experience next time.   And hopefully they open one in the SW Valley sometime, that would be cool ya know!

photos.caption: Photo of Corleone's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apparently that is $2.50 worth of fries!!! Jeeeeezus, rip off alert! 37 French fries... In case you were wondering.

AmcvBdAnJx5KqmFxL0FqCQ.text: Great for what it is.  Sometimes you just want a greasy fatty cheesy juicy meaty ball of deliciousness wrapped in a bun.   You know it's awful for you.  You know you'll regret it with a bloated overstuffed belly.  But damn it's good!  This place delivers on all levels for that.  Excellent cheesesteaks just about however you like them.  Cooked fresh.  Fries are fresh too.  The pizza isn't bad if you like a plain Jane slice of NY style pie either.  Is it gourmet.  No.  Is it great for what it is.  Absolutely.  Now get a samich, take an extra dose of cholesterol medicine and don't tell your cardiologist!

5tdQ6EgjOZfvyiw_M9PoOg.text: Spent $40 on a large pizza wings and a vegetarian sandwich, pizza was mediocre Wings were overly cooked so they were hard, the sandwich had provolone cheese lettuce tomato bell peppers and soggy spinach and it taste like nothing worse sandwich I think I've ever had! Would definitely never eat there again

ObT5isRE5rqJ-T5vOLBFTA.text: Best cheesesteak in town.   Get cheese whiz sauce with your fries.  Service is fast and friendly decor is a philly history lesson.  Five stars.

CVFdtr1pOb6NkSM1oB-gDQ.text: Stopped in today for lunch and ordered an Italian hoagie. I know they are known for the Philly cheesesteak, but I felt like some Italian meats. This sandwich was right on point, filled was lots of delicious deli meats. I godfathered it and added pepperoni. The regular size was so huge I could only eat half. The guy at the register was nice and even remebered us and said here's youse guys order without calling our number when it was ready. The oil and vinegar is what I normally add on my sandwiches and theirs was great. I've ordered Jimmy John's Italian night club when I go there and if you've ever had that Corleon's is 100 times better. Its about the same price and at Corleon's the meats are way better quality, a bigger sandwich and overall tastes way better. The only negative thing I have to say is there was no napkins in the bag and I forgot to grab some when we were waiting. I definitely know where to go next time I'm craving a sandwich and even though the Italian hoagie was great I'm going to try the cheesesteak.

PdevDj6UMcG57oA7m47P2Q.text: Best Philly cheesesteak in the valley.  You can get cheez whiz on it and they use sliced ribeye.  Most places do not offer cheez whiz, which every place in Philly ofers....Can't get closer to Philly than that!  Go!  Now!

zm8C-bADCsFJNNWbr8HxkQ.text: Love the food and the staff is laid back and friendly.  You can't go wrong with the Original and don't forget to add fries.  Take in a little Rocky while you eat.

rkR7lxiiGzKtQuMqDwZS_g.text: I ordered online and I chose the incorrect location. When I got here we figured out the issue.
